meanings.definition: To combine or merge multiple things into a single, unified whole.
meanings.sent1: She is consolidating her toys into one big box.
meanings.sent2: The company is consolidating its various departments into one efficient team.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces were consolidating together as if they were old friends reuniting.
meanings.sent4: His efforts in consolidating the community were like building a strong bridge between neighbors.
meanings.sent5: The image of consolidating all the colors into a beautiful painting stuck in her mind.

meanings.definition: To strengthen or make more solid.
meanings.sent1: Adding more cement is consolidating the foundation of the house.
meanings.sent2: The treaty aims at consolidating the peace in the region.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's powers were consolidating, making him invincible against evil.
meanings.sent4: Her resolve was consolidating like a rock in the face of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The idea of consolidating their friendship with a secret handshake excited the kids.

meanings.definition: To make something stronger or more secure by reinforcing it.
meanings.sent1: He is consolidating the shelf by adding extra brackets.
meanings.sent2: The army is consolidating their defenses to prevent any attacks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was consolidating its nest with twigs and leaves.
meanings.sent4: Her love was consolidating his heart, making him feel safe and cherished.
meanings.sent5: The image of consolidating the walls with steel beams made the building seem indestructible.
